senses.usage_notes: This word is often used to emphasize a statement, similar to 'even' in English.

senses.grammar_hint: The verb 'дарить' is used in the infinitive form to describe giving gifts without specifying a time frame or frequency.

senses.usage_notes: The word 'дворец' can refer to various types of palaces, including those used by royalty or for sports events.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'девочка' is a feminine noun, used to refer to a young girl. It can also be used in the plural form 'девочки' when referring to more than one girl.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'двадцать' is used to count items in plural form, as it changes based on the gender of nouns it modifies.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'двенадцать' is used in both singular and plural forms without changing its spelling.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also mean 'affair' or 'matter', depending on context.

senses.usage_notes: This word is commonly used to refer to a day in general or specific contexts such as Monday, Tuesday, etc.

examples.en: Kasha isn't just oatmeal; there are other kinds of grains too.

senses.grammar_hint: When used as a conjunction, когда́ is followed by the past tense or the present perfect tense.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as a feminine noun in Russian to refer to a Chinese woman or girl.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also mean 'team' in a sports or workplace context.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both as a noun in singular or plural form without changing its spelling.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is a common noun and can be used in various contexts, often in plural form as 'комнаты'.

senses.usage_notes: Often used to indicate the conclusion of an event or period.
senses.grammar_hint: Can function as a noun and is often preceded by the preposition 'в' when referring to a specific end point.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in many contexts to agree with someone or to say something is true.

examples.en: Of course, I will do it.

examples.ru: 这个周末我们去看了一场摇滚音乐会。

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in the infinitive form without 'to' before it, e.g., 'называться' (to be called).

source.seed_extra_ru: нсв I — собра́ть (соберу́, соберёшь) св I 1) собра́ть друзе́й 2) собира́ть моне́ты

source.seed_extra_ru: (сове́тую, сове́туешь) нсв I — посове́товать (посове́тую, посове́туешь) св I + инф.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in the infinitive form after certain verbs like 'хотеть' (to want) or 'нужно' (it's needed).

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as an adjective in all cases, numbers, and genders.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to both formal and informal gatherings, such as a meeting of a club or a family gathering.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used in the masculine form and agrees with the gender of the subject.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in infinitive form after certain verbs like 'учитываю' (take into account) or 'начинаю' (start).

examples.ru: Врач сообщал пациенту новости о здоровье.

senses.usage_notes: This word is commonly used in both formal and informal contexts.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective, so it agrees in gender, number, and case with the noun it modifies.

source.seed_extra_ru: нсв I — спроси́ть (спрошу́, спро́сишь) св II

student years

examples.en: I am a student.
My brother is a student.
This student studies physics.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used to add information or to mention another fact alongside the one already stated.

examples.ru: Я люблю читать книги, также и писать.
examples.en: I love reading books, as well as writing.

examples.ru: Также мы можем выбрать другой вариант.
examples.en: We can also choose another option.

examples.ru: Он приготовил суп, также и бутерброды для обеда.
examples.en: He made soup, as well as sandwiches for lunch.

senses.grammar_hint: Такой is used to modify nouns or noun phrases, often in comparisons or definitions.

examples.en: This is such a nice person.

examples.ru: Я предпочитаю такой кофе с молоком.
examples.en: I prefer coffee with milk.

examples.ru: Такой холодный день подходит для прогулки.
examples.en: Such a cold day is perfect for a walk.
I'll take a taxi to the airport.

examples.ru: Мы ждали такси у входа в магазин.
examples.en: We waited for a taxi by the store entrance.

examples.ru: Он обычно ездит на такси, потому что не любит водить машину.
examples.en: He usually takes a taxi because he doesn't like driving.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a person's inherent ability or skill in a particular field.

examples.ru: У него есть талант играть на гитаре.
examples.en: He has a talent for playing guitar.

examples.ru: Мне кажется, ты обладаешь талантом вmarketing.
examples.en: I think you have a talent for marketing.

examples.ru: К сожалению, многие люди не раскрывают свой талант.
examples.en: Unfortunately, many people do not fulfill their potential talent.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective, so it must agree in gender, number, and case with the noun it modifies.

examples.en: She is a talented singer.
He has a talented son.

examples.ru: Это очень талантливое место для работы.
examples.en: This is a very talented place to work.
She loves dancing.
There was a lot of dancing at the party.
I am learning to dance.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is in the infinitive form, used to express purpose or future intention.

examples.en: I came here to dance.
We will be dancing the whole evening.
Dancing made her feel free.
I was born in a country.
This country is famous for its forests.
We are traveling through the whole country.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'тарелка' is a feminine noun in Russian, so it uses adjectives that agree with it in gender and number.

examples.ru: На тарелке лежит блюдо с едой.
examples.en: There's a dish with food on the plate.

examples.ru: Мама положила картофельные овощи на большую тарелку.
examples.en: Mom put some vegetables on a large plate.

examples.ru: Он промокнул руки салфеткой после того, как съел со своей тарелки.
examples.en: He wiped his hands with a napkin after eating from his plate.
I ate soup today.
Mom always cooks a tasty soup.

examples.ru: У нас в морозильнике много разнообразных супов.
examples.en: We have many different soups in the freezer.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used to show possession or belonging, similar to 'your' in English.

examples.en: This is your scarf.
Is your computer broken?
My friend, yours is also beautiful.
I read the text in the morning newspaper.

examples.ru: Текст был слишком длинным, поэтому я не смог его полностью перепечатать.
examples.en: The text was too long, so I couldn't copy it completely.

examples.ru: Каждый текст должен быть уникальным и интересным для читателей.
examples.en: Each text should be unique and interesting for readers.

senses.usage_notes: Сыр is used in various dishes, both as a main ingredient or an addition.

examples.ru: Я добавил немного сыра в суп.
examples.en: I added some cheese to the soup.

examples.ru: Он любит есть сырный тост на завтрак.
examples.en: He likes to eat a cheese toast for breakfast.

examples.ru: Мама сделала пирог с сыром и овocтями.
examples.en: Mom made a cheesecake with oats.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a mobile or landline phone.

examples.en: I called him on the telephone.

examples.ru: У меня новый телефон с хорошей камерой.
examples.en: I have a new phone with a good camera.

examples.ru: Она не отвечает на звонки, когда её нет дома.
examples.en: She doesn't answer calls when she's not at home.

source.seed_translation: hard, firm; firmly; firmer 1) hard surface 2) firm character
source.seed_extra_ru: (-ая, -ое, -ые); твёрдо сравн.ст. твёрже 1) твёрдая пове́рхность 2) твёрдый хара́ктер

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective and can be used with both masculine and feminine nouns in Russian.

examples.en: Hard ice.
She has a firm character.

examples.ru: Мясо должно быть твёрдым, чтобы подойти для стейка.
examples.en: The meat should be hard to be suitable for a steak.

senses.grammar_hint: Там is used to indicate a location, often at a distance from the speaker or the subject of discussion.

examples.en: He lives there.
The police came there.
It's very hot there.

examples.ru: Он прилетел из города, где его встретили с телеграммой.
examples.en: He flew into town where he was met with a telegram.

examples.ru: Мы отправили ребенку телеграмму о том, что он поступил в университет.
examples.en: We sent the child a telegram informing him that he had been accepted to university.

examples.ru: Она приехала домой после того, как получила телеграмму от своего брата.
examples.en: She came home after receiving a telegram from her brother.

examples.ru: Вот новый метод техники йоги, который поможет вам расслабиться.
examples.en: Here's a new yoga technique that will help you relax.

examples.ru: Существует множество техник в области программирования.
examples.en: There are many programming techniques in existence.

examples.ru: Она умела использовать различные техники в кулинарии.
examples.en: She was skilled at using various techniques in cooking.

senses.usage_notes: This word can describe anything related to technology or professional skills.

examples.ru: Этот компьютер слишком сложен для меня, он технический.
examples.en: This computer is too technical for me.

examples.ru: Он специализируется на техническом обслуживании автомобилей.
examples.en: He specializes in technical car maintenance.

examples.ru: Ее работа связана с техническим анализом данных.
examples.en: Her job involves technical data analysis.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used at the beginning of a sentence to indicate that something is happening in the present moment.

examples.en: Now I understand.
Let's start the lesson now.
Are you home now?
The child writes their lessons in the copybook.
The copybook is used for drawing diagrams.

examples.ru: Мама купила дочери тетрадь для домашних заданий.
examples.en: Mom bought her daughter a copybook for homework.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both formally and informally in speech.

examples.en: The aunt prepared lunch.

examples.ru: Моя тётя живёт в соседнем городе.
examples.en: My aunt lives in the neighboring city.
Do you have an aunt?
He plays tennis.
We came to a tennis match.

examples.ru: У нее хорошо развита вы抡力，所以她能打网球。
examples.en: She has good arm strength, so she can play tennis.
I bought a new TV.

examples.ru: Телевизор у нас есть, но мы его hardly смотрим.
examples.en: We have a TV, but we hardly watch it.

examples.ru: На стенде телевизора висит фотография моей семьи.
examples.en: There's a photo of my family hanging on the TV stand.

senses.usage_notes: This term can be used in formal or informal contexts, often to address colleagues or friends.

examples.en: Hello, friend!
We were colleagues.
Friend, help me with this!

examples.ru: Это тёплый день, можно поехать в парк.
examples.en: It's a warm day, we can go to the park.

examples.ru: Стиральное вещество должно быть тёплым для лучшего воздействия.
examples.en: The detergent should be warm for better results.

examples.ru: Мне стало тёплее, когда я пил горячий чай.
examples.en: I felt warmer when I drank hot tea.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'тогда' to indicate a sequence or timing of events.

examples.ru: Я приготовил ужин, затем тогда лег на диван.
examples.en: I prepared dinner, then lay down on the sofa.

examples.ru: Пришёл гость, и тогда мы начали играть в карты.
examples.en: The guest arrived, and then we started playing cards.

examples.ru: Тогда у меня не было времени на это.
examples.en: Then I didn't have time for that.
The night was dark.

examples.ru: Тёмный угол комнаты был немного пугающим.
examples.en: The dark corner of the room was a bit frightening.

examples.ru: Она нравится одеваться в темные цвета, особенно тёмную одежду.
examples.en: She likes to wear dark colors, especially dark clothing.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in various contexts such as weather, health, or cooking.

examples.en: I have a high temperature.
The air temperature today is 20°C.

examples.ru: Температуру нужно мерить утром и вечером.
examples.en: You should take your temperature in the morning and evening.

senses.usage_notes: Торт is commonly used in both formal and informal contexts, especially during celebrations like birthdays.

examples.ru: Сегодня у нас торт на дне рождения Лены.
examples.en: Today we have a cake for Lena's birthday.

examples.ru: Мама испекла вкусный торт для праздника.
examples.en: Mom baked a delicious cake for the celebration.

examples.ru: Выбираем торт из предложенных в меню.
examples.en: We choose a cake from those offered in the menu.

senses.usage_notes: This phrase is often used to clarify or explain something.

examples.ru: Мне нравится читать, то есть я люблю погружаться в мир книг.
examples.en: I like reading, that is, I enjoy diving into the world of books.

examples.ru: Он учился на физике, то есть специализировался на естественных науках.
examples.en: He studied physics, that is, he specialized in natural sciences.

examples.ru: Это не означает, что она богата, то есть она просто экономит деньги.
examples.en: This doesn't mean she's rich; that is, she just saves money.

senses.usage_notes: Use 'тот' to point out a specific thing in a larger group or context.

examples.ru: Я видел тот дом, где вы жили.
examples.en: I saw the house where you lived.

examples.ru: Это тот человек, который пригласил меня на вечеринку.
examples.en: This is the guy who invited me to the party.

examples.ru: Тот лев, которого вы видели в зоопарке, был очень большой.
examples.en: The lion you saw in the zoo was very big.

examples.ru: В концентрированном растворе каждая молекула отдельно стоит, как точка на большой площади.
examples.en: In a concentrated solution, each molecule stands alone like a point on a large surface.

examples.ru: Точка зрения автора отличается оригинальностью и глубиной.
examples.en: The author's point of view is original and profound.

examples.ru: На карте вы видите точку, отмечивающую место нахождения магазина.
examples.en: On the map, you see a point marking the location of the store.

senses.usage_notes: This word is often used in contexts related to performances or plays.

examples.en: I work at the theatre.

examples.ru: Мы пошли в театр посмотреть спектакль.
examples.en: We went to the theatre to watch a play.

examples.ru: Это один из лучших театров города.
examples.en: This is one of the best theatres in the city.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both adjectival and attributive forms.

examples.ru: Точное решение задачи важно для успеха.
examples.en: The exact solution to the problem is important for success.

examples.ru: Он дал точный ответ на вопрос.
examples.en: He gave an exact answer to the question.

examples.ru: Мы проверили его данные и нашли точные совпадения.
examples.en: We checked his data and found exact matches.

senses.usage_notes: This word is used to agree with a statement or add emphasis that something is also true.

examples.ru: Я люблю кофе, тоже мой друг любит его.
examples.en: I like coffee, my friend likes it too.

examples.ru: Он хорошо играет на гитаре, тоже я учу играть.
examples.en: He plays the guitar well, I'm learning to play too.

examples.ru: Там много красивых цветов, тоже в парке есть.
examples.en: There are many beautiful flowers there, there are also some in the park.

senses.usage_notes: This word is often used to emphasize exclusivity or limitation in sentences.

examples.en: Only I know the truth.
We are leaving only on weekends.
Only you can do this.

examples.ru: Мне нужно купить транспорт для поездки в город.
examples.en: I need to buy transport for my trip to the city.

examples.ru: Она работает водителем, поэтому ей нужен собственный транспорт.
examples.en: She works as a driver, so she needs her own transport.

examples.ru: Транспорт в этом городе очень разнится по цене.
examples.en: The transport in this city varies a lot in price.

source.seed_translation: quiet, still, calm; quietly; quieter 1) still sound 2) calm weather 3) quiet person
source.seed_extra_ru: (-ая, -ое, -ие); ти́хо сравн.ст. ти́ше 1) ти́хий звук 2) ти́хая пого́да 3) ти́хий челове́к

senses.grammar_hint: This word can function as an adjective describing people, places, or things.

examples.ru: Ти́хий день был превосходным для чтения книг.
examples.en: A quiet day was perfect for reading books.

examples.ru: Она была ти́хим человеком и не любила шумных компаний.
examples.en: She was a quiet person and did not like noisy gatherings.

examples.ru: Ночь была ти́хой, и мы услышали только далекий вой狼狗
examples.en: The night was quiet, and we only heard the distant barking of wolves.

source.seed_extra_ru: (тра́чу, тра́тишь) нсв II — истра́тить (истра́чу, истра́тишь) св II; потра́тить (потра́чу, потра́тишь) св II

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is intransitive, meaning it does not take a direct object. It's often used with nouns or gerunds.

examples.ru: Я трачу много времени на то, чтобы изучать русский язык.
examples.en: I spend a lot of time learning Russian.

examples.ru: Она часто тратит деньги на шопинг.
examples.en: She often spends money on shopping.
It's important not to waste time.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'три' is used as a cardinal number in Russian.

examples.en: I have three books.
I am three years old.
Let's make three attempts.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also function as an adjective or a noun, but in most cases, it is used as an ordinal number.
senses.grammar_hint: When used as an adjective, 'третий' agrees in gender and number with the noun it modifies. It does not take a definite article before a masculine singular noun.

examples.en: It's the third day of the week.

examples.ru: У неё третий класс в школе.
examples.en: She is in the third grade at school.

examples.ru: Мы уже прошли третий уровень игры.
examples.en: We have already completed the third level of the game.

senses.usage_notes: Used to indicate a place or direction towards which someone or something is going.

examples.ru: Иди туда, где ты нашел ключ.
examples.en: Go there where you found the key.

examples.ru: Он пошел туда, чтобы купить продукты.
examples.en: He went there to buy some groceries.

examples.ru: Я уеду туда, когда закончу работу.
examples.en: I'll go there when I finish my work.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used as a standalone number or combined with other numbers in larger ones, like тридцать пять (thirty-five).

examples.en: I am thirty years old.
He bought thirty apples.

examples.ru: Тридцать процентов учеников класса пришли на урок.
examples.en: Thirty percent of the class came to the lesson.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'тринадцать' is used in both singular and plural forms without changing its spelling.

examples.en: I have thirteen rubles.
There were thirteen students in the class.

examples.ru: Тринадцатое апреля — День защитника Отечества в России.
examples.en: April 13th is Defender of the Fatherland Day in Russia.

senses.grammar_hint: This word can be used as an adjective to describe a person, situation, or task that requires effort or is challenging.

examples.en: This is a difficult test.

examples.ru: Он столкнулся с трудной ситуацией на работе.
examples.en: He faced a difficult situation at work.
She has a difficult character.

examples.ru: Мне нужно доехать до университета, я пойду на трамвае.
examples.en: I need to get to the university, so I'll take the tram.

examples.ru: Недалеко от моего дома проходит трамвайная линия.
examples.en: There's a tram line not far from my home.

examples.ru: На трамвае удобно добираться до центра города.
examples.en: It's convenient to get into the city center by tram.

examples.ru: Мне нужно доехать до парка, я пойду на троллейбусе.
examples.en: I need to get to the park, I will take the trolleybus.

examples.ru: Троллейбус приехал, и мы вошли в салон.
examples.en: The trolleybus arrived, and we went into the cabin.

examples.ru: В городе много троллейбусов, они помогают развозить пассажиров.
examples.en: There are many trolleybuses in the city; they help transport passengers.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'ты' to address someone familiar or in informal settings.

examples.en: You are a smart person.
Please prepare some coffee for me.
Aren't you coming today?

senses.usage_notes: Туфли are commonly used in both formal and informal contexts, depending on the type of shoe.

examples.en: I need to buy new shoes.
She always wears trendy shoes.

examples.ru: Дети играют и не обращают внимания на свои туфли.
examples.en: The children play and don't notice their shoes.

source.seed_extra_ru: нсв I — уби́ть (убью́, убьёшь) св I

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in both present and past tense, for example: Он убивает животных (He kills animals) и Убивали волков на границе (They used to kill wolves on the border).

examples.en: Thieves kill their victims.
You cannot kill; it is illegal.
He killed in the war.

senses.grammar_hint: The verb 'уважать' is used in the infinitive form, such as 'он уважает её' (he respects her).

examples.en: He respects his senior colleague.

examples.ru: Мне нужно вас уважать, потому что вы директор.
examples.en: I need to respect you because you are the director.

examples.ru: Я не уважал его мнение раньше, но теперь да.
examples.en: I didn't respect his opinion before, but now I do.

source.seed_translation: to, at, by, from 1) Let’s meet by the store. 2) I have this book. 3) I was at doctor’s. 4) She learnt cooking from her mother. 5) We need to find out from Ivan about the concert.
source.seed_extra_ru: с р.п. 1) где? — Встре́тимся у магази́на. 2) у кого? — У меня́ есть э́та кни́га. 3) где? (у кого?) — Я был у до́ктора. 4) у кого? — Она́ учи́лась гото́вить у ма́мы. 5) у кого? — О конце́рте на́до узна́ть у Ива́на.

senses.grammar_hint: The particle 'у' can function as a preposition or a part of various verb phrases.

examples.en: I have a key.
Let's go to the teacher.
Do you have many books?

source.seed_translation: confident; confidently, sure; with decision; assured

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective, so it agrees in gender and number with the noun it modifies.

examples.ru: Он был уверененный в своих силах и смог выполнить работу качественно.
examples.en: He was confident in his abilities and managed to complete the work well.

examples.ru: Ее уверенная манера говорить произвела впечатление на аудиторию.
examples.en: Her confident manner of speaking impressed the audience.

examples.ru: Я уверененный в своих знаниях, поэтому не боюсь задавать вопросы.
examples.en: I am confident in my knowledge, so I'm not afraid to ask questions.

source.seed_translation: hard, heavy, severe, bad; hardly, heavily 1) heavy luggage 2) hard work 3) bad temper 4) severe case
source.seed_extra_ru: (-ая, -ое, -ые); тяжело 1) тяжёлый бага́ж 2) тяжёлый труд 3) тяжёлый хара́ктер 4) тяжёлый слу́чай

examples.en: The book is hard to understand.
I don't like heavy work.
You're too heavy to carry.

senses.usage_notes: This word is used as a form of respectful address, often for older men or esteemed colleagues.

examples.en: Dear Uncle Stepan!
...to the respected director...

examples.ru: Мне очень повезло встретить уважаемого человека.
examples.en: I was very lucky to meet a respected person.

senses.usage_notes: This term is used to describe stress in words, which can change a word's meaning or grammatical category.

examples.en: The main stress is on the first syllable.

examples.ru: Ударение приходится на последний слог слова.
examples.en: The stress falls on the last syllable of the word.

examples.ru: В этом предложении ударение изменяет смысл слова.
examples.en: In this sentence, the stress changes the meaning of the word.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective and can be used in both masculine and feminine forms, as well as with neuter nouns, but without the ending -ое.

examples.en: This is a surprising film.

examples.ru: У неё удивительная способность быстро учиться.
examples.en: She has an amazing ability to learn quickly.

examples.ru: Этот человек находит удивительные способы решения проблем.
examples.en: This person finds amazing ways to solve problems.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both as a noun and in various contexts, such as describing someone who travels for pleasure or discussing tourism.

examples.ru: Я турист, приехавший в город на две недели.
examples.en: I am a tourist visiting the city for two weeks.

examples.ru: В туристической индустрии много работы в выходные.
examples.en: There's a lot of work in tourism on weekends.
My friend works as a tourist guide.

senses.grammar_hint: Триста is used to express a quantity of three hundred in Russian, typically followed by the genitive case of a noun.

examples.en: I have three hundred rubles.
There were three hundred students in the class.

senses.usage_notes: Used to count large quantities, often in formal or official contexts.

examples.ru: В магазине было две тысячи товаров.
examples.en: There were two thousand items in the store.

examples.ru: Он работал одну тысячу часов в месяц.
examples.en: He worked one thousand hours a month.

examples.ru: Его возраст составил три тысячи рублей.
examples.en: His age was three thousand rubles.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both formal and informal contexts to express pleasure or enjoyment.

examples.ru: Я получил большое удовольствие от этой поездки.
examples.en: I had great pleasure from this trip.

examples.ru: Он не обладает удовольствием от игры в шахматы.
examples.en: He does not derive pleasure from playing chess.

examples.ru: Мне было большое удовольствие познакомиться с вами.
examples.en: It was a great pleasure to meet you.

source.seed_extra_ru: нсв I — уе́хать (уе́ду, уе́дешь) св I

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is often used in continuous forms, such as 'уже уезжает' (already leaves) or 'увидимся, когда я уеду' (see you when I leave).

examples.ru: Он начинает уезжать домой после работы.
examples.en: He starts leaving for home after work.

examples.ru: Вода в бассейне была холодной, поэтому я не захотел там купаться.
examples.en: The water in the pool was cold, so I didn't want to swim there.

senses.grammar_hint: This word can function as an adjective in Russian, modifying nouns or other adjectives.

examples.en: It's a good day for a walk.
He has a good character.
The products in the store are good.
He always dreamed of becoming a hockey player.

examples.ru: В нашей команде есть хороший хоккеист.

examples.ru: Полина играет в хоккей и считает себя настоящей хоккеисткой.
examples.en: Polina plays hockey and considers herself a real hockey player.

source.seed_extra_ru: (хочу́, хо́чешь; хоти́м, хоти́те) нсв I + инф.

senses.usage_notes: This verb is used to express desires or wishes.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a professional artist or an amateur one.

examples.ru: Этот термин не используется в современной России для обозначения российского лидера.

examples.ru: Цвет флага России синий, белый и красный.

examples.ru: Этот дом очень красивый благодаря своей светлой цветовой гамме.

examples.ru: Мне нравится этот цвет волос у нее – светло-русый.
examples.en: I like her hair color – light blonde.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used to talk about habitual actions or actions that are repeated regularly.

examples.en: He goes to school.
We go for a walk after lunch.

examples.ru: Она всегда ходила на работу пешком.
examples.en: She always walked to work.

source.seed_extra_ru: мн.ч.; ед.ч. цвето́к, р.п. ед.ч. цветка́

senses.usage_notes: Цветы are often used in expressions related to beauty, nature, or occasions such as birthdays or weddings.

examples.en: There were various flowers in the garden.
I brought her a bouquet of flowers.

examples.ru: Цветник в нашем саду не так большой, но там растут разные красивые цветы.
examples.en: Our garden's flower bed isn't very big, but it has some beautiful flowers growing there.
I bought bread at the bakery.

examples.ru: Мы слегка подсушили испеченный хлеб на сковороде.
examples.en: We slightly dried out the baked bread on a pan.

examples.ru: Хлеб является важной частью русской кухни.
examples.en: Bread is an important part of Russian cuisine.

senses.usage_notes: The word 'цена' can refer to both the price of something or its value, depending on context.

examples.ru: Цена на этот товар обычно высокая.
examples.en: The price for this product is usually high.
Evaluate the value for the services provided.

examples.ru: Я не согласен с ценой в этом магазине.
examples.en: I disagree with the price in this store.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used to describe something that is not solidly one color, but contains multiple colors.

examples.ru: Эта книга цветная, она содержит много иллюстраций различных цветов.
examples.en: This book is multicolored; it contains many illustrations in various colors.

examples.ru: Цветной экран компьютера выглядел ярче обычного.
examples.en: The multicolored computer screen looked brighter than usual.

examples.ru: Мы привезли цветные карандаши для рисования.
examples.en: We brought colored pencils for drawing.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective, so it needs to agree in gender, number, and case with the noun it modifies.

examples.en: The city's central park
The main entrance to the building
Questions related to the central topic of discussion

senses.usage_notes: This word is used to describe something that has not been damaged or changed in any way.

examples.ru: Целый день я работал над проектом.
examples.en: I worked on the project all day.
This is a whole tablet, not half of one.

examples.ru: Целый город был уничтожен в результате бомбардировки.
examples.en: The entire city was destroyed as a result of the bombing.

source.seed_extra_ru: (целу́ю, целу́ешь) нсв I — поцелова́ть (поцелу́ю, поцелу́ешь) св I

senses.usage_notes: This verb can be used in both formal and informal contexts, but often has a romantic connotation.

examples.en: They were kissing on the street.

examples.ru: Я не хотел бы целовать ее перед всеми.
examples.en: I don't want to kiss her in front of everyone.

examples.ru: Мне было приятно, когда он меня поцеловал.
examples.en: It was nice when he kissed me.

senses.usage_notes: Чайник is commonly used in both singular and plural forms, but the plural form is rarely distinguished as 'чайники'.

examples.ru: Я налил воду в чайник и поставил его на плётр.
examples.en: I poured water into the teapot and put it on the stove.

examples.ru: Чайники разных форматов стоят у входа.
examples.en: Teapots of different sizes are placed by the entrance.

examples.ru: Мы приготовили чайник чёрного чая для гостей.
examples.en: We prepared a pot of black tea for the guests.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used as a standalone noun to refer to time measured in hours.

examples.ru: В один час он прочитал три главы книги.
examples.en: In one hour, he read three chapters of the book.

examples.ru: У меня есть всего два часа на подготовку к экзамену.
examples.en: I only have two hours to prepare for the exam.
I will arrive in half an hour.

senses.grammar_hint: Часто is used as an adverb modifying verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs to indicate frequency.

examples.en: He often drinks tea.
We often meet with friends.

examples.ru: Домашние животные иногда едят растения, но часто это не так.
examples.en: Domestic animals sometimes eat plants, but this is not often the case.

source.seed_translation: centre 1) the centre of the city 2) historic centre

senses.definition: centre 1) the centre of the city 2) historic centre
senses.translation: centre 1) the centre of the city 2) historic centre
senses.usage_notes: Центр can refer to both physical locations like a city center or abstract concepts like a central role.

examples.en: The city center is very lively.

examples.ru: Исторический центр у нас старинный и привлекательный.
examples.en: Our historic center is old and attractive.

examples.ru: Он играл центральной ролью в проекте.
examples.en: He played a central role in the project.

senses.usage_notes: Часы́ are used to tell time and can refer to either an analog or digital clock.

examples.ru: Я посмотрел на часы́ и понял, что пора уходить.
examples.en: I looked at the clock and realized it was time to leave.

examples.ru: У меня нет часов с собой, поэтому я не знаю, сколько времени.
examples.en: I don't have a watch with me, so I don't know what time it is.

examples.ru: Моя бабушка дала мне старый деревянный часы́ на Новый год.
examples.en: My grandmother gave me an old wooden clock for New Year.

examples.ru: Цифра в电话中断了，无法继续提供输出。请稍后再试或使用文本接口。
examples.en: The digit is in the middle of the number.

examples.ru: Это всего лишь цифра, она не имеет реального значения.
examples.en: This is just a digit; it doesn't have any real meaning.

examples.ru: Я написал код и проверил каждую цифру для ошибок.
examples.en: I wrote the code and checked each digit for errors.

senses.usage_notes: This word is used to describe something that appears dark like a cloud or ink.

examples.en: A black pencil
A black cat
A dark sky

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'чем' to compare two things, often in questions or negative sentences.

examples.ru: Я не умею играть на скрипке так, как мой брат.
examples.en: I cannot play the violin as well as my brother.

examples.ru: Это не так интересно, чем вы думаете.
examples.en: This is not as interesting as you think.
She is taller than I am.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective can be used with all genders in Russian, so it remains 'честный' for masculine nouns, 'честная' for feminine nouns, and 'честное' for neuter nouns.

examples.en: An honest person always tells the truth.
This is a fair businessman.
She has an honest appearance.
Today I have three meetings.

examples.ru: Всего было десять человек на конференции.
examples.en: There were ten people at the conference in total.
The number of students has increased to one hundred.

examples.ru: Дети с удовольствием ходят в цирк.
examples.en: Children enjoy going to the circus.

examples.ru: На цирковом шоу можно увидеть各种马戏团表演，例如骑独轮车的演员和高空走钢丝的人。
examples.en: At a circus show, you can see various acts such as unicycle riders and tightrope walkers.

examples.ru: Мой отец часто водил меня в цирк зимой.
examples.en: My father often took me to the circus in winter.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'часть' can be used as a noun in various contexts, but its exact form may change based on grammatical case.

examples.en: This is only part of the whole project.

examples.ru: Я показал ему только малую часть коллекции.
examples.en: I showed him only a small part of the collection.

examples.ru: Каждая часть машины имеет свою функцию.
examples.en: Every part of the machine has its own function.

source.seed_translation: through, across, in 1) to go through the forest 2) to come back in an hour
source.seed_extra_ru: с в.п. 1) пройти́ че́рез лес 2) верну́ться че́рез час

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'через' is used to indicate passage through something, often in a more formal context than simply using 'through'.

examples.en: We will go through the city.

examples.ru: Он пришел к нам через дверь.
examples.en: He came to us through the door.
The village is situated through the river.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'четвёртый' is used as an ordinal number, agreeing in gender, number, and case with the noun it modifies.

examples.ru: Это четвёртый раз, когда я прихожу в эту библиотеку.
examples.en: This is the fourth time I've come to this library.

examples.ru: Вчера был четвёртый день нашей командировки.
examples.en: Yesterday was the fourth day of our business trip.

examples.ru: Он занимается на четвёртом курсе университета.
examples.en: He is in his fourth year at university.
I love reading books.

examples.ru: Он провел весь вечер в чтении.
examples.en: He spent the entire evening reading.
Reading helps expand your vocabulary.
Books on the reader’s desk.
The reading room of the library.
This is a reader’s desk workspace.

senses.grammar_hint: Use "что" when asking questions or expressing uncertainty about something.

examples.en: What do you want to drink?
What is happening?
I don't know what to do.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used to introduce a purpose or intention clause in a sentence.

examples.ru: Я пришёл сюда, чтобы поговорить с тобой.
examples.en: I came here to talk to you.

examples.ru: Она ушла домой, чтобы подготовиться к завтрашнему дню.
examples.en: She went home to prepare for the next day.

examples.ru: Я здесь только что, чтобы помочь тебе.
examples.en: I'm here just to help you.

source.seed_extra_ru: (чу́вствую, чу́вствуешь) нсв I — почу́вствовать (почу́вствую, почу́вствуешь) св I

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is intransitive and does not take a direct object.

examples.en: I feel cold.

examples.ru: Он не чувствует радости от победы.
examples.en: He doesn't feel joy from the victory.
Feelings are very important in relationships.

examples.ru: Он надел шапку и пошел на улицу.
examples.en: He put on a cap and went outside.

examples.ru: Вот такая красная шапка есть в магазине.
examples.en: There's a red cap like this in the store.

examples.ru: Мальчик потерял шапку на操场上，小明正在专心地听着老师讲课。请根据上文内容，预测小明接下来的动作可能性最大的是：
examples.en: The boy is listening attentively to the teacher's lecture on the playground. Given this context, the most likely next action for Xiaoming would be:

senses.grammar_hint: The verb читать is always in the infinitive form when used as a noun or an adjective, for example: Читающий человек (A reader).

examples.en: She loves reading books.
I need to read the new magazine.
Reading is good for the mind.
He is a good reader.

examples.ru: Я не люблю читать длинные книги, предпочитаю короткие рассказы для читателя с малым вниманием.
examples.en: I don't like reading long books; I prefer short stories for readers with short attention spans.

examples.ru: Читатель нашел ошибку в этой статье.
examples.en: The reader found an error in this article.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also be used in compound words or phrases, such as 'шахматистка', which means a female chess player.

examples.ru: Он с детства был шахматистом и часто участвовал в турнирах.
examples.en: He was a chess player since childhood and often participated in tournaments.

examples.ru: Мой дядя – шахматист, он увлекается этим спортом.
examples.en: My uncle is a chess player; he is into this sport.

examples.ru: Шахматисты со всего мира собрались на крупный турнир.
examples.en: Chess players from all over the world gathered for a major tournament.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'шесть' is used as a cardinal number in Russian.

examples.en: I have six books.
There are six students in the class.
Six o'clock in the evening.

senses.usage_notes: Чай is commonly used in various contexts, such as 'чай с друзьями' (tea with friends).

examples.ru: Я люблю пить чай с молоком и сахаром.
examples.en: I like to drink tea with milk and sugar.
There is a cup of tea on the table.
We invited friends over for tea.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'чистый' is an adjective that can be used in both masculine and feminine forms, depending on the noun it modifies.

examples.en: A clean table.
A clean hand.
He always stays clean.
The room had a large bookcase.

examples.ru: Я положил книгу на верхнюю полку шкафа.
examples.en: I put the book on the top shelf of the bookcase.

examples.ru: Шкаф в спальной комнате был пустым.
examples.en: The bookcase in the bedroom was empty.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'шестнадцать' is used in both masculine and feminine forms, but when referring to age or a position, it takes the neutral form.

examples.en: She is sixteen years old.

examples.ru: Он окончил школу в шестнадцатом году жизни.
examples.en: He graduated from school at the age of sixteen.
Sixteen people came to the meeting.
He is into chess.

examples.ru: Мы играли в шахматы весь вечер.
examples.en: We played chess all evening.
Chess develops logical thinking.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as an ordinal number, often followed by a noun in the genitive case.

examples.en: This is the sixth day of the week.

examples.ru: Он пришёл на шестой час вечера.
examples.en: He arrived at six o'clock in the evening.

examples.ru: В шестом классе они изучают физику.
examples.en: In sixth grade, they study physics.
Mom bought a scarf for her son.
I wrapped the scarf around my neck.

examples.ru: У неё всегда в сумке лежит несколько шарфов.
examples.en: She always has several scarves in her bag.
I went to school.

examples.ru: У неё есть два ребёнка и две школы.
examples.en: She has two children and two schools.

examples.ru: Мой дядя учитель в этой школе.
examples.en: My uncle is a teacher in this school.

senses.grammar_hint: Шестьдесят is used as a cardinal number in Russian, following nouns when they are indefinite but preceding them when specific.

examples.en: Sixty students came to the lecture.
I am sixty years old.

examples.ru: В этом году было шестьдесят дней без осадков.
examples.en: This year there were sixty days without rain.

source.seed_extra_ru: (шучу́, шу́тишь) нсв II — пошути́ть (пошучу́, пошу́тишь) св II

senses.usage_notes: This verb can be used in both reflexive (сам) and non-reflexive forms.

examples.ru: Они любят шутить друг с другом.
examples.en: They love to joke with each other.

examples.ru: Не надо так шутить, это может обидеть.
examples.en: Don't joke like that, it might hurt.

examples.ru: Научи меня шутить, я очень скромный.
examples.en: Teach me how to joke, I'm very shy.

senses.grammar_hint: This number is used to denote quantities of six hundred items or units in a straightforward manner.

examples.en: I have six hundred rubles.

examples.ru: В библиотеке есть шестьсот книг на русском языке.
examples.en: There are six hundred books in Russian in the library.

examples.ru: У него было шестьсот метров ткани.
examples.en: He had six hundred meters of fabric.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both singular and plural forms, but 'шутка' is more commonly used as a singular noun.

examples.en: His joke angered everyone at work.

examples.ru: Не обращай внимания на её шутку, она это часто делает.
examples.en: Don't take her joke seriously; she does this often.

examples.ru: Сегодня мы слушали много шуток от повара.
examples.en: Today we heard a lot of jokes from the chef.

senses.usage_notes: This term is commonly used to refer to students in primary or secondary schools.

examples.ru: Школьникам разрешили выходить на уроке без разрешения учителя.
examples.en: Students were allowed to leave the classroom without permission from a teacher.

examples.ru: Мой брат школьник и он очень любит математику.
examples.en: My brother is a pupil and he loves math very much.

examples.ru: Вот мой сын, школьник пятого класса.
examples.en: Here's my son, a fifth-grade pupil.

senses.usage_notes: Это слово часто используется в контексте обсуждения денег, работы и ресурсов.

examples.en: I study economics as a subject.

examples.ru: Эта компания работает в сфере экономики.
examples.en: This company operates in the field of economics.

examples.ru: Мне нужно больше знать об экономике, чтобы сделать правильный выбор.
examples.en: I need to know more about economics to make the right choice.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as an adjective in Russian.

examples.en: The street is very wide.
The door is over a meter wide.
This is a television with a wide screen.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is intransitive and does not take a direct object.

examples.en: It might be the neighbor's dog making noise.
The door was creaking on old hinges.

examples.ru: Шуметь не мешает, если это природа.
examples.en: It doesn't bother me if it's nature making noise.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'экономический' as an adjective to describe something related to economics or economy.

examples.en: Economic growth has slowed down.
This is an economic theory.

examples.ru: Его работа связана с экономическим анализом.
examples.en: His work involves economic analysis.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a guided tour or trip, often for educational purposes.

examples.ru: Мы записались на экскурсию в музей.
examples.en: We signed up for an excursion to the museum.
This will be an interesting excursion.
Children love such excursions.
The guide showed us the history of the city.
We asked the guide about the attractions.

examples.ru: Экскурсовод рассказал нам об обычаях местных жителей.
examples.en: The guide told us about local customs.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to describe a person or their behavior as energetic or full of energy.

examples.ru: Он энергичный и всегда готов помочь.
examples.en: He is energetic and always ready to help.

examples.ru: Вот энергичная девушка, которая работает на стройке.
examples.en: Here's an energetic girl who works on the construction site.
This project requires a dynamic leader.
This car uses a lot of energy.
His job requires a lot of energy.
I can feel energy in his voice.

senses.grammar_hint: Это is used to point out something specific or introduce a new idea.

examples.en: This is a new house.
This is my friend.
This is very delicious food.

senses.grammar_hint: Экзамен is used as a countable noun in Russian, so you can say 'one exam' or 'two exams'.

examples.ru: Я сегодня сдавал экзамен по истории.
examples.en: I took my history exam today.

examples.ru: Ей нужно было пройти два экзамена перед тем, как получить степень.
examples.en: She had to pass two exams before getting her degree.

examples.ru: Мы проводим экзамен по английскому языку завтра утром.
examples.en: We are holding an English exam tomorrow morning.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used to refer to something close at hand or previously mentioned in a conversation.

examples.en: This house looked beautiful.

examples.ru: Э́тот человек сказа́л мне об этом.
examples.en: This person told me about it.

examples.ru: Э́тот день был осно́вным для меня.
examples.en: This day was crucial for me.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'экономист' is a masculine noun in Russian, so it agrees with other words in gender and number.

examples.ru: Он является экономистом в крупной международной компании.
examples.en: He is an economist at a large international company.

examples.ru: Моя сестра учится стать экономистом в университете.
examples.en: My sister is studying to become an economist at the university.

examples.ru: Этот экономист считает, что повышение налогов будет негативным для экономики.
examples.en: This economist believes that raising taxes will be negative for the economy.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also be used in phrases like 'черный брючный костюм с юбкой' (a black trouser suit with a skirt), where it's often used to describe women’s clothing.

examples.ru: Моя подруга носят юбку в офисе.
examples.en: My friend wears a skirt at the office.

examples.ru: У неё много разных юбок для различных случаев.
examples.en: She has many different skirts for various occasions.

examples.ru: В этом сезоне модные юбки выше пояса.
examples.en: This season's fashionable skirts are above the waist.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a floor in a building, often used in real estate or construction contexts.

examples.en: The fourteenth floor.
The house has ten floors.
We live on the first floor.

senses.usage_notes: Used to refer to a traditional Russian soup made from cabbage.

examples.en: I had shchi today.
Mom made us shchi.
Shchi is very delicious food.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'южный' is an adjective and can be used to describe objects, places, or directions. It should agree in gender, number, and case with what it modifies.

examples.en: The southern part of the country.
Southern wind direction.

examples.ru: Дом сюда был построен южным строителям.
examples.en: This house was built by southern builders.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both as a countable noun (a joke) or an uncountable noun (humor).

examples.en: Humour makes life more enjoyable.

examples.ru: Он всегда находит юмор в трудных ситуациях.
examples.en: He always finds humour in difficult situations.

examples.ru: Это был шутливый комментарий, а не намеренная оскорбительность.
examples.en: It was a jesting comment, not intended to be offensive.

senses.usage_notes: This word can also refer to a young man, but in some contexts, it might imply someone still in their early stages of development or training.

examples.en: The youth helped his senior colleague.

examples.ru: Он был юношей, когда начал свою карьеру.
examples.en: He was a young man when he started his career.
The youths are preparing for the sports competitions.
I love chocolate.

examples.ru: Мама купила дочери шоколад на день рождения.
examples.en: Mom bought her daughter chocolate for her birthday.

examples.ru: Еда в этом ресторане вкусная, особенно шоколадный десерт.
examples.en: The food in this restaurant is tasty, especially the chocolate dessert.
I ate an apple.
I put the apple in the basket.
This is a very sweet apple.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is an adjective, so it agrees in gender, number, and case with the noun it modifies.

examples.en: A legal advisor deals with legal issues.

examples.ru: Это юридическая сделка, которая требует акта о согласии.
examples.en: This is a legal transaction that requires an agreement in writing.

examples.ru: Юридический отдел занимается подготовкой всех необходимых документов.
examples.en: The legal department takes care of preparing all the necessary documents.

source.seed_translation: to appear, to present, to be

senses.grammar_hint: The verb "являться" is used in more formal or literary contexts. It often implies a sense of being something or belonging to a category.

examples.en: This person turned out to be a famous actor.

examples.ru: Он всегда явлется первым на всех собраниях.
examples.en: He is always the first to arrive at all meetings.

examples.ru: Это явилось причиной для отмены мероприятия.
examples.en: This became a reason for canceling the event.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'я' is used to refer to oneself in the nominative case.

examples.en: I am a student.
I came early.
I love reading books.

examples.ru: Язык - это средство общения между людьми.
examples.en: Language is a means of communication between people.

examples.ru: Он изучает язык для работы в зарубежной компании.
examples.en: He studies the language to work in an international company.
Body language helps express emotions.
Language is a means of communication.

examples.ru: Он изучает язык для работы в международной компании.
examples.en: He studies the language to work in an international company.

examples.ru: Этот язык имеет богатый глагольный обиход.
examples.en: This language has a rich vocabulary of verbs.

senses.grammar_hint: January is often used as a standalone noun without any additional grammatical form.

examples.ru: Месяц январь начинается с праздника Рождества.
examples.en: The month of January starts with the holiday of Christmas.

examples.ru: В январе холодно, поэтому нужно носить зимнюю одежду.
examples.en: It's cold in January, so you need to wear winter clothes.

examples.ru: Моя годовая подписка действует с января по декабрь.
examples.en: My annual subscription is valid from January to December.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in various contexts, such as describing a person's age or their stage of life.

examples.en: This is youth and young age.

examples.ru: Юность — это время самых ярких моментов жизни.
examples.en: Youth is the time of the most vivid moments in life.

examples.ru: Мы вспоминаем нашу юность с радостью и теплотой.
examples.en: We remember our youth with joy and warmth.

senses.grammar_hint: Юг is used as a noun and can be pluralized by adding '-ов' or '-овы'.

examples.en: The house is located in the south of the city.

examples.ru: Юг России знаменит своими песчаными пустынями.
examples.en: The southern part of Russia is famous for its sandy deserts.

examples.ru: Мы отправляемся в юг, чтобы исследовать новые горизонты.
examples.en: We are heading south to explore new horizons.

examples.ru: Он решил стать юристом после окончания университета.
examples.en: He decided to become a jurist after graduating from university.

examples.ru: Моя сестра работает юристом в юридической компании.
examples.en: My sister works as a jurist in a law firm.

examples.ru: Вот твой диплом, теперь ты юрист!
examples.en: Here's your diploma, now you're a jurist!
I love eating eggs.
There are fresh eggs in the refrigerator.
Mom made breakfast with eggs.

source.seed_translation: bright, brilliant; brightly; brighter 1) bright light 2) brilliant personality
source.seed_extra_ru: (-ая, -ое, -ие); я́рко; сравн.ст. я́рче 1) я́ркий свет 2) я́ркая ли́чность

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to describe things that are bright or brilliant in color, appearance, or quality.

examples.en: The bright light illuminated the entire room.

examples.ru: Яркий красный цвет этого платья привлекает внимание.
examples.en: The brilliant red color of this dress catches the eye.

examples.ru: Яркая игра на солнце создавала радужные блики.
examples.en: The bright play of light on the sun created rainbow-like sparkles.
Berries grow on bushes.
There are many berries for sale in the store.

examples.ru: Я люблю съесть свежие ягоды летом.
examples.en: I love eating fresh berries in summer.
